lines.text: That beautiful head, with fire in his eyes... his stride must be twenty feet long, and when he runs his hooves sound like thunder.
He's dead. Dead drunk. He's young and wild, but he'll grow out of it, just like you did.
There's a story they tell that whoever catches him gets what's coming to him, his judgment right here on earth.
Look at Thunderhoof, Marguerita. He's the beginning of our ranch. Ten days from now, we'll be under our own roof, your own house.
You'll find yourself married to an old man. But I reckon you'd rather herd horses.
He wasn't a bad kid. Just young, wild. He never grew up because I wouldn't let him.
